{"step_by_step_thinking": "Tuberculous otitis media is characterized by multiple perforations as mentioned in Document [25]. Pale granulations are also a characteristic feature of the disease as stated in Document [1] and Document [13]. Document [22] mentions that the disease often presents with painless otorrhea, indicating that pain is not a typical characteristic. Document [15] mentions that the disease presents with insidious onset of painless watery drainage, which contradicts the option of thin odourless fluid.", "answer_choice": "C. Pain"}
